docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court's decision on Friday to hear a challenge to tough abortion restrictions in Texas raises questions about the legal fate of similar laws in more than a dozen other states.

headline.main: Supreme Court's Texas Abortion Ruling to Have Broad Impact in States

headline.main: How to Pick a Meditation App

docs.abstract: A number of new meditation apps promise a journey to mindfulness, but with so many different options, it’s tough to know what to look for.
docs.snippet: A number of new meditation apps promise a journey to mindfulness, but with so many different options, it’s tough to know what to look for.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is giving an election-year hearing to a dispute over state regulation of abortion clinics in the court's first abortion case in eight years.

docs.lead_paragraph: The police were summoned to the town of Wallenfels after a woman called an emergency doctor to say that she had discovered what appeared to be body parts.

byline.contributor: Claire Barthelemy contributed reporting from London, and Katarina Johannsen from Berlin.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court's key rulings on abortion, dating to the landmark 1973 decision that legalized the procedure nationwide, have long provoked social, religious and political tensions.

headline.main: Factbox: Major U.S. Supreme Court Rulings on Abortion Rights

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court took up a major new abortion case on Friday, agreeing to hear a challenge by abortion providers to parts of a restrictive, Republican-backed Texas law that they contend are aimed at shutting clinics that offer the procedure.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Decide Major Abortion Case for First Time Since 2007

docs.lead_paragraph: Four years after cutting off funding for Planned Parenthood, the state of Texas says it has been able to rebuild its safety net, in what could be a model for Republicans in Congress who hope to defund the nation's largest family planning provider at the national level.

headline.main: Texas Tries to Stitch a Safety Net Without Planned Parenthood

docs.lead_paragraph: Surgeons at the Cleveland Clinic are set to become the first in the United States to transplant a uterus.

headline.main: Uterus Transplants May Soon Help Some Infertile Women in the U.S. Become Pregnant
headline.print_headline: Doctors to Try Transplanting a Donor Uterus

docs.abstract: Doctors at Cleveland Clinic will become first in United States to transplant uterus into woman who does not have one, enabling her to become pregnant and give birth; transplants will be temporary, with uterus being removed after recipient has had one or two babies; experimental procedure, which has only been completed successfully in Sweden, poses many risks.
docs.snippet: Surgeons at the Cleveland Clinic are set to become the first in the United States to transplant a uterus.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 100 women who blame their pregnancies on errant birth control packaging have joined a negligence lawsuit filed in Philadelphia against several drug companies.

headline.main: Lawsuit: Birth Control Mix-Up Results in 113 Pregnancies
